news.title: Associates of drugs gang probed over Offaly petrol-bomb attack that killed boy (4) suspected of over a dozen firebombings
news.summary: Associates of a drugs gang being investigated over the arson attack that killed a young boy and his grand-aunt in Offaly are suspected of carrying out more than a dozen firebombings.

news.title: Status Orange warnings as Storm Bram to bring ‘very windy and stormy conditions’ to Ireland
Use of AI by director of insolvent company in court proceedings criticised
news.summary: A company director being pursued for €765,000 following the collapse of her packaging firm has been using artificial intelligence to “churn out reams” of legal papers, the High Court has heard.

news.title: The Indo Daily: The murder of Connemara teen Siobhán Hynes, and her killer’s fresh bid for freedom
news.summary: “Goodbye, see you later, thanks.” These were the last words Aine Hynes ever heard from her little sister Siobhán as she dropped her at a local disco in Carraroe, Connemara.

news.title: David W Higgins: Taxi drivers need to get over ‘go-slow’ protests and embrace fixed pricing
news.summary: There’s a buzz when you land in a new European city, especially one further east where prices are cheaper. As a group of us walked out of Bratislava airport at Easter, we faced that timeless choice: do we hail or open the apps? Fixed price or metre?

news.title: ‘In a lot of cases there isn’t enough income there for both of them to start afresh’. Who gets the house in a divorce?
news.summary: Catherine (53) and a mother of three, says. “I fully expected when we decided to divorce that the house would be half his, even though the deeds were in my name,” she says.

news.title: Miguel Delaney: Mo Salah’s struggle for form shows that no player remains truly untouchable
news.summary: Mohamed Salah was back in training with Liverpool on Sunday and yesterday. The mood is said to have been fine – the players putting up a front with friendly chats.

news.title: Lucinda O’Sullivan’s restaurant review: Díon brings unbeatable views, snazzy interiors and an upmarket menu (just make sure to preorder wines over €1,000!)
news.summary: Dublin now has its tallest restaurant – Díon on the 10th floor of the Sam Stephenson designed former Central Bank on Dame Street. Perched 150 feet up, it may be the baby of them all but nonetheless the views out over our fair city are pretty dramatic.

news.title: Family estrangement is on the rise – why are so many of us going ‘no contact’ and what is the fallout?
news.summary: Ever since Tolstoy wrote in 1878 that “all happy families are alike; each unhappy family is unhappy in its own way”, not that much has changed.

news.title: ‘My new neighbours are complaining about normal farm work – what can I do?’
news.summary: We are farming in the west of Ireland and have recently run into difficulties with a new neighbour. Many years ago, we sold several sites along the road beside our yard. All the original buyers were local people who understood the nature of farming and rural life.
